poem:
**Spoils**

Dorneywood whispers 
of power, 
ivory keys 
dance under 
fresh curtains. 
Silence fills 
rooms 
where politics 
peters out, 
where men 
exchange homes 
and hands. 
Soon, another 
will measure 
length 
of silk, 
echoes 
of privilege 
flutter 
like torn 
memos.
